ArticleTitle.sentence: A novel heterodimerization partner for thyroid hormone receptor.

event.clue: A novel heterodimerization partner for thyroid hormone receptor.

AbstractText.sentence: Retinoid-like receptors play a central role in hormonal responses by forming heterodimers with other nuclear hormone receptors.

event.clue: Retinoid-like receptors play a central role in hormonal responses by forming heterodimers with other nuclear hormone receptors.
Retinoid-like receptors play a central role in hormonal responses by forming heterodimers with other nuclear hormone receptors.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study we have identified the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR) as a new thyroid hormone receptor (THR) auxiliary nuclear protein, heterodimerizing with THR in solution.

event.clue: In this study we have identified the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR) as a new thyroid hormone receptor (THR) auxiliary nuclear protein, heterodimerizing with THR in solution.

AbstractText.sentence: Although these heterodimers do not recognize a classical thyroid hormone response element (TRE) characterized by direct repeat separated by four nucleotides (DR+4), PPAR behaves as a dominant negative regulator of thyroid hormone (TH) action.

event.clue: Although these heterodimers do not recognize a classical thyroid hormone response element (TRE) characterized by direct repeat separated by four nucleotides (DR+4), PPAR behaves as a dominant negative regulator of thyroid hormone (TH) action.

Although these heterodimers do not recognize a classical thyroid hormone response element (TRE) characterized by direct repeat separated by four nucleotides (DR+4), PPAR behaves as a dominant negative regulator of thyroid hormone (TH) action.

AbstractText.sentence: However, a TH-dependent positive effect is elicited by selective interaction of the THR beta-PPAR but not the THR alpha-PPAR heterodimer with a novel TRE (DR+2).

event.clue: However, a TH-dependent positive effect is elicited by selective interaction of the THR beta-PPAR but not the THR alpha-PPAR heterodimer with a novel TRE (DR+2).

AbstractText.sentence: The critical region of THR beta was mapped to 3 amino acids in the distal box of the DNA binding domain.
Hence, PPAR can positively or negatively influence TH action depending on TRE structure and THR isotype.
